title: New consultation on improving management of industrial emissions
lead: The UK aims to develop a tailored regime for better protecting the environment and public health from industrial pollution following Brexit

title: Left Right Left Right. Squaddies get energy efficient marching orders
lead: Air source heat pumps and solar panels have been installed in barracks

title: Danish PM to lead global commission on people-centred clean energy transitions
lead: The Global Commission on People-Centred Clean Energy Transitions will examine the social and economic impacts of the shift to cleaner energy technologies as well as issues of affordability and fairness

title: Symbio Energy faces £100k Ofgem fine for late renewables payments
lead: The proposed penalty follows four late payments into the FiT and RO schemes

title: Lightsource bp completes $380m financing for two Texas solar projects
lead: That includes the 163MW Elm Branch and 153MW Briar Creek solar projects that are expected to offset greenhouse gas emissions by a total of 370,000 metric tons annually

title: UK launches new global coalition to address climate change impacts
lead: The Adaptation Action Coalition has been developed by the UK in partnership with Bangladesh, Egypt, Malawi, the Netherlands, Saint Lucia and the UN

title: Melting away: Earth lost 28 trillion tonnes of ice between 1994 and 2017
lead: The loss is equivalent to a 100-metre thick sheet of ice covering the whole of the UK, according to new research

title: Pilotless hydrogen-powered jets for domestic flights?
lead: The plan is to automate a light utility aircraft that could carry up to 19 passengers travelling through the ‘UK’s first’ zero carbon regional network

title: future Net Zero hits first milestone!
lead: We have much more content planned for year two including all the build up to COP26

title: Scotch whisky industry toasts to net zero spirits by 2040
lead: The Scotch Whisky Association has also pledged to have all new product packaging reusable, recyclable and compostable by 2025
